newsitem.title: USA: Mitchell Energy acquires Texas pipeline.
newsitem.headline: Mitchell Energy acquires Texas pipeline.

text.p: Mitchell Energy & Development Corp said Friday it had bought a pipeline stretching through a number of counties in Texas in order to move gas from fields to processing plants.
The company said it bought the pipeline -- located in Montgomery, Harris, Fort Bend, Jackson and Wharton counties -- from Mobil Corp's Vanderbilt-Beaumont Pipeline Co for an undisclosed sum.

It said it will use the pipeline -- 110 miles of 14-inch and 26 miles of six-inch -- to move unprocessed gas from new and existing oil and gas fields located along the pipeline route to one or more processing plants in the area.
It said it will connect the pipeline to its existing gathering facilities near the Katy Processing Plant, which is operated by Exxon Corp.
